TextDB package¶

Submodules¶

TextDB.Collection module¶

class TextDB.Collection.Collection(endpoint, collection, key=None)¶
add(name, d)¶

Add a new text document to TextDB.

Makes a POST request to TextDB server with document encoded in URL.

Parameters:
  • name (string) – The name of the document to store (Non-numeric chars only)
  • f (file) – The file that contains the document
  • s (string, optional) – The string that contains the document

Examples

>>> f = open('../d.txt')
>>> db.add('d', f)
>>> db.list()
['a', 'b', 'c', 'd']

>>> db.add('d', str="This is document d")
>>> db.list()
['a', 'b', 'c', 'd']
>>> db.get('d').get_text()
"This is document d"
collection = None¶
endpoint = None¶
get(name)¶

Gets a cursor for document.

Returns a cursor containing the url endpoint to access the doc that it references. NOTE: does not actually get anything at this point.

Parameters:name (string) – The name of the document to retrieve
Returns:The DB cursor for the requested document
Return type:Cursor

Examples

>>> db.list()
['a', 'b', 'c']
>>> c = db.get('a')
>>> c
<Cursor.Cursor>
key = None¶
list()¶

Lists all documents in DB.

Makes a GET request to TextDB server to get names of all available documents.

Returns:A list containing strings of
Return type:list

Examples

>>> db.list()
['a', 'b', 'c']
remove(name)¶

Removes an existing text document from TextDB.

Makes a POST request to TextDB server with name. NOTE: does not remove words from word index yet.

Parameters:name (string) – The name of the document to store (Non-numeric chars only)
Returns:indicating whether remove was successful or not
Return type:boolean

Examples

>>> db.list()
['a', 'b', 'c']
>>> db.remove('a')
>>> db.list()
['b', 'c']

TextDB.Cursor module¶

class TextDB.Cursor.Cursor(_endpoint, key=None)¶
endpoint = None¶
exp = None¶
get_next_sentence(strip=True)¶

Get the next sentence of the document.

Does what you think it does.

Returns:Next sentence
Return type:string

Examples

>>> a = db.get('a')
>>> a.get_next_sentence()
"This is the first sentence of a."
>>> a.get_next_sentence()
"This is the second sentence of a."
get_sentiment()¶

Get the sentiment score of the document.

Makes a GET request to the TextDB server which calculates sentiment score of the document specified.

Returns:sentiment score
Return type:float

Examples

>>> a = db.get('a')
>>> a.get_sentiment()
0.2156
get_size()¶

Get size of the document.

Makes a get request to TextDB server and returns the number of words in the document specified.

Returns:number of words in document
Return type:int

Examples

>>> a = db.get('a')
>>> a.get_size()
102534
get_text(start=0, limit=0)¶

Get the text in the document.

Makes a get request to the TextDB server requesting for the text document. TODO: add start and limit functionality to enable user chunking of docs.

Parameters:
  • start (string) – start word
  • limit (string) – number of words to get
Returns:

The text document
Return type:

string

Examples

>>> a = db.get('a')
>>> a.get_text()
"This is document a"
get_word_frequency()¶

Get the word frequency table of document.

TODO: Fetches the word frequency table by making a GET request to TextDB server. No precaching yet.

Returns:dict containing the word frequency
Return type:string

Examples

>>> a = db.get('a')
>>> a.get_word_frequency()
{'word1': 10, 'word2': 11}

TextDB.DB module¶

class TextDB.DB.TextDB(_endpoint='http://localhost:3001', username=None, password=None)¶
create_collection(collection, encoding)¶

Creates a new collection in TextDB.

Makes a POST request to TextDB server.

Args:

Examples

>>> db.list()
['a', 'b', 'c', 'd']
>>> db.create_collection('1')
>>> db.list()
['1', 'a', 'b', 'c']
drop(collection)¶

Drops a particular collection from TextDB.

Makes a POST request to TextDB server.

Args:

Examples

>>> db.list()
['a', 'b', 'c', 'd']
>>> db.drop('d')
>>> db.list()
['a', 'b', 'c']
